Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Enum UhOhListener.Remedy

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<UhOhListener.Remedy>
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.UhOhListener.Remedy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<UhOhListener.Remedy>
    Enclosing interface:
    UhOhListener
    public static enum UhOhListener.Remedy
extends java.lang.Enum<UhOhListener.Remedy>
    The suggested remedy for each UhOhListener.UhOh. This can be used as a proxy for the severity of the issue.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant Description
      RECYCLE_CONNECTION
      This remedy only applies to UhOhListener.UhOh.CONNECTION_STILL_ALIVE.
      RESET_BLE
      Calling BleManager.reset() is probably in order.
      RESTART_PHONE
      Might want to notify your user that a phone restart is in order.
      WAIT_AND_SEE
      Nothing you can really do, hopefully the library can soldier on.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • RECYCLE_CONNECTION

        public static final UhOhListener.Remedy RECYCLE_CONNECTION
        This remedy only applies to UhOhListener.UhOh.CONNECTION_STILL_ALIVE. When this happens, we've found that some phones simply need to connect, then disconnect, and the connection gets closed. However, other phones require you to unbond, then bond again, THEN connect and disconnect. A long, stupid process for sure, but we found it to work almost 100% of the time.

      • WAIT_AND_SEE

        public static final UhOhListener.Remedy WAIT_AND_SEE
        Nothing you can really do, hopefully the library can soldier on.

      • RESET_BLE

        public static final UhOhListener.Remedy RESET_BLE
        Calling BleManager.reset() is probably in order.
        See Also:
        BleManager.reset()

      • RESTART_PHONE

        public static final UhOhListener.Remedy RESTART_PHONE
        Might want to notify your user that a phone restart is in order.
